cons: Long hours (but they make it clear in your interview, so no surprise here). Yearly compensation is minimal. Cafeteria gets repetitive really fast and the prices are high.
pros: You learn something everyday. Work with great people, including management. Do an outstanding job and it is easy to move up or around the company. Great benefits

cons: Standing long hours and no much break times
advice: None
pros: Disccounts given to employees every three years

cons: none its all good great
advice: nothing
pros: pay and flexible hours awesome stuff

cons: They can do better for people of color. Too often my fellow coworkers of color were targeted for minuscule offenses. This often held them back when it came time for promotion. My white counterparts would make the same offenses but they would go unseen by management. I don't think this is fair at all. All in all, I still believe that it's a wonderful place to work.
advice: Give everyone and equal opportunity to grow no matter their race.
pros: You'll have a chance to work with some of the smartest people to ever walk the face of the earth. Creating WOW moments for customers every single day is probably the most fulfilling part of the job!
summary: Most Enriching Position I've Ever Held

cons: Retail hours, not given information early so sometimes you are left in the dark about products or soluitons until Apple releases it to the public even if you know things are coming.
pros: Great culture, products, team, management, vision etc. I couldn't have imagined a better place to work while I was in school.

cons: A con would be making it how it is for example the iPhone it's so specific in detail that I'm sure it's challenging for some to make such a product
pros: The best reason to work at Apple is to become an engineer at the facility and making some of these best products they have to offer for the people

cons: hoursholidayslanguage barriers of customersconstant turnoverconfidentiality
pros: BenefitsCo-workersfast pacedcompany culturedesign of stores

cons: There are no downsides to it.
pros: All it's cracked up to be.

cons: The job will make you work harder than you have ever worked even when you most likely have other things going on. For the most part, you are contributing to the team and everyone works hard and does their part to contribute. There are times your family won't see you enough.
advice: Thank you for working as hard as you do.
pros: Great, positive environment working with some of the most talented people in the world! Amazing Agents, Team Managers, and all levels of management, up to the Business and Director level. Your career is driven by you and there are so many opportunities to develop if you are willing to put the time in to be the best.
summary: Work hard, play harder with some of the most talented people in the world!

cons: High stress, conflict resolution with disgruntled customers.
advice: More breaks.
pros: Wonderful coworkers, great compensation, fantastic discount.

cons: Being able to enrich a customer's life with Apple product. Endless possibilities.
pros: Having to deliver bad news to customers

cons: Customer can be pretty difficult at times.
pros: Great place to work, always challenging,

cons: Not a clear path for promotion
pros: Apple takes time and money to invest into their employees

cons: Get yelled at a lot by customers
pros: More fulfilling than Specialist Role

cons: Nothing really. I loved working here to be honest.
advice: Keep up the good work, maybe fast-track promotions.
pros: Good pay, co-workers, and overall working environment

cons: Pay is a bit less than what you might expect from such a successful company however, the benefits are great!
advice: Hire people to work shifts instead of random hours. It is difficult at best to have a work/life balance when you do not have consistency in your work hours.
pros: Constantly learning from some of the most amazing people I've ever met. They really want to share their knowledge and help you to become proficient.

cons: Working with customers is always a drag because anyone is allowed in the store.
advice: More pay for lower wage works, its hard to make a living working on low pay.
pros: Great products to sell and nice management. Discounts on amazing gear.

cons: None that I know of.
pros: Meeting new people everyday and finding out what makes them unique all within your 10-15 interaction is an amazing experience. Management and the team are always so cheerful and friendly. They all support you with anything and everything that you do and they all want you to succeed at your goals both personal and professional. Fantastic work/life balance as they try to accommodate you for the things you have to do ou… tside of work, like having a life!

cons: A lot of traveling. Away from home alot.
pros: Excellent company to work for.

cons: customer attitudes, not a lot of supervision..very learn as you go
pros: Great company culture, experience working with people of different backgrounds, great pay

cons: Work-life balance is practically non existent. If you are looking for a career and are not applying for management, then opportunities to progress are non existent.Micro Management (but it is a tech company)Micro PoliticsIf you are entering with the thought of applying to corporate, then think again.
advice: Apple has some brilliant people who work in their retail stores AND their corporate offices. The sad fact is that if you enter the retail side, you are ALWAYS going to be tarred with a 'retail' brush. For those that aspire, it's a dead-end.Apple used to be a place to go and give as much as you could to your customers every day and be paid for doing so. Now it's simply catering for the next dividend to the big sha… re holders who are just padding their portfolios and egos. Your mantra has changed from "The people" to "the sale at any cost"Apple is a fantastic company: it's just searching for a way to "be" a company that's hip for the hipsters and rock steady for business and innovative for both. Take more notice of your people and don't just ask them to come up with stuff and then move on. Circus's and games didn't help the Roman Empire, Apple. Caveat Emptor
pros: Competitive workplace, latest technology, strive for perfection, lots of deals and great benefits and as long as you know your stuff, your customers will love you.

cons: i work by the street and its a lot of noise
advice: Please make new buildings way from traffic please
pros: i get discounts on new apple products like the iphone 7
summary: the best job i can get

cons: Any regular retail cons. Long hours, holidays, weekends, launch days. Working with the general population can be very challenging at times
advice: Continue to hire wonderful people. Make it easier to move up within the retail store structure for people who have been there for a while.
pros: If you are going to work retail, you might as well work for the best. I thoroughly enjoyed my time at the fruit stand. The values and lessons you learn are applicable to any future job profession

cons: None apple is the best
advice: None apple is the best company
pros: Great pay great people awesome

cons: The inconsistent schedule and the abuse from customers.
pros: The people you work with are life long friends.

cons: No work life balance. Unrealistic goals.
pros: Innovative. Helpful. Career oriented. Knowledge

cons: Career Opportunities and work/life balance.
pros: Great company to work for, great benefits. Good for doers, people that like to work and prepared to work hard.

cons: It can be hard to advance at an Apple Store, and there are a lot of politics and seniority that comes into play when you try to move up.
advice: Keep up the good work, I would say just to not feed into the drama and politics when it comes to managing the team.
pros: Working at an Apple Store was the perfect job for me during college. The management understands that you have other commitments outside of work, and is super flexible in making time for your life outside of Apple.

cons: Haven't had a problem yet
pros: Good salary, amazing recruitment process and till now there hasn't been a month where they haven't contacted me to ask it was going.

cons: Very busy but isnt too bad
advice: None
pros: Great benefits and great people

cons: The almost/not quite cult behavior is not for everyone. Being retail I get it... but don't expect them to cater to the hours that you can or can't work.
pros: Fun, Uplifting and motivating work environment. I loved the people I worked with and learned a lot from my experience.

cons: The constant change in processes and operating systems can be challengingn to keep up with and remember.
pros: As a part time employee, you get benefits and sick time! They also do tuition reimbursement.

cons: Not given the opportunity to advance
advice: No favoritism
pros: I believe in that Apple culture and how it prides it self on Customer Service

cons: Cupertino is a bit of a boring place.

pros: Beer bashes, free dinner, free snacks, department off-sites

cons: But hard to advance from at home advisor

cons: Nothing is bad about this company. I loved every day.
pros: Loved the work. Was excited to work here everyday

cons: Commute from the city takes a long time. Secrecy is an obscession which makes it more difficult to create your own network.
pros: Good projects for a DSP guy. Casual and opened people. Salaries and overall conditions are good.

cons: Too many contractors, outcalls and lack of work life balance
pros: Knowledge, pay, hours, co workers and apple swag

cons: I worry about being able to move up in the company. I've heard from multiple people that it's almost impossible to go to corporate after working for retail.
pros: The people I work with are the coolest people I've met. I'm constantly learning and developing not only in the workplace, but also as a human being.
summary: Best job I've ever had. Great benefits, incredible people. I'm stimulated every day.

cons: Ambiguous for promotion, hard to get hired
advice: Better promotional rates. Get competitive for what work is done in retail. Stem the flow of talent leaving for higher wages.
pros: Super progressive great benefits and helpful

cons: Competitive, Compensation, Support, Staffing, Attitudes.
advice: Take charge when needed but let your team do the work because if you prepared them properly there is nothing to fear.
pros: Knowledge, Technology, Teaching, Connecting, Exchanging, Enriching, Specializing.

cons: You'll read a lot of negative reviews -- is it stressful, yes, but what customer service job isn't? I felt like I was constantly in hyper-learning mode for the first 6-8 months. If you don't like continuous change and constant learning, then this may not be the best fit. (To me it's not a con) I truly don't have any real "cons"
advice: Keep listening to the voice of the advisors on the front lines, as you've been doing.
pros: There is not enough GOOD things that I can say about working for Apple. If you've ever dreamed of working for this company and thought you knew what it would be like -- you're probably not even close. It is truly everything I thought it would be and more. In this position getting to work from home is a huge plus. In my honest opinion they offer a very generous compensation package. If you love working with customers … and helping even the most frustrated with their tech issues, and you're comfortable working alone -- then this is a great position for you! If you excel at your position there are opportunities for advancement and expanding your overall skills.

cons: I did not have any regrets while working here.
pros: Great pay, great benefits, great managers.

cons: No cons. Apple treats its interns very well
pros: Amazing experience. Interns are treated like full time employees

cons: Easy to get "stuck"thereSome don't utilize feedback
advice: Don't have favorites
pros: Great BenefitsAbility to move upExcellent training

cons: The retail schedule can be tough. Although, Apple is taking steps to improve this area.
pros: Development focused if you are driven to make yourself better.

cons: You can feel like you hit a wall at some points due to lack of opportunities to get promoted. Overall, it is not the worst feeling, but it pushes you to work harder.
pros: It is a wonderful environment that revolves around enriching lives. You get to have flexibility and learn new roles every day.

cons: there really aren't any cons
pros: great amazing fun cool nice

cons: Work life balance could be a little better.
pros: Great perks. Cutting edge work.

cons: Some benefits are reducing year after year like every where else. For example, lunch price and travel. Overall it's a great place to work.
pros: Great pay and bonuses. Excellent health care benefits and work environment. Every individual is responsible for his/her work, when at the same time, everyone is part of a team. Love Steve Jobs' model.
summary: One of the best place to work.

cons: very repetitive duties every day
pros: Got to work from home

cons: No room to grow, lower pay than what most are qualified to do, customers are pretty crazy sometimes.
advice: Increase retail salaries and make the starting wage $20/hr. This would set Apple apart from the competition and would help indirectly grow the brand as Apple is recognized for treating their workers fairly.
pros: Apple has some of the best benefits in the world and offer the best products in the market. In addition, the people that you work with are some of the best and brightest around.

Many want more, but in truth the pay is appropriate.Work with the smartest and most dynamic people you'll ever meet in your life.You will be challenged every single day, if you're not it's because you're not trying.

cons: A lot of complaints from customers and fire drills from executives that need to be handled even on weekends.
advice: Need to give more training and time to help junior engineers understand code path.
pros: Get to work on products that many people are excited about. Get to work on technologies that are cutting edge.

advice: Give every one in Technical Support a hefty raise, they deserve it.Get out of the back more, but besides that thanks for keeping everyone motivated!
pros: The people you work with are great. Benefits are amazing!!! If you're okay with ambiguity it's an ever changing job which keeps things exciting. You can be yourself :)

cons: Processes and procedures constantly in development- this is both bad and goid
pros: The People, the atmosphere, the growth opportunities

cons: Retail Schedule is not the best environment for a parent.Pay is substantial but having a family is can be harder.
pros: People are wonderful. Benefits are amazing! Pay is good.

cons: Internal systems are not very well supported and occasionally cause difficult customer situations. The role does not change very often and seems to have less focus from corporate team.
advice: Focus on development with this role. Recommit energy to supporting the Business Team. Make it apart of daily operations and communication.
pros: Exciting position in the Apple Store! You get to develop strong relationships with SMB business customers using Apple technology. Noncommissioned Sales with a primary focus on customer success, which can be very fulfilling.

cons: This place is great to work for
advice: More bonuses.
pros: Great place to work, salary is very competetive, awesome Chefs to work with, they have great benefits, emoloyees are encourage to continue with school.

cons: Very Goal oriented. Managers job is for you to do yours. Keep you nose clean and meet the benchmark you should be fine. Lots of goals to move around laterally, but moving up is very rare and you have to be very lucky.
advice: More options to move up and around management in AHA
pros: It is a really nice place to work. Benefits are excellent, vacation and sick time are great and Apple pays for a bunch of stuff such as child care. Don't forget those Apple Discounts!
summary: Great Place to work if you're goal oriented

cons: -As the company has grown, it can often be hard to see changes be made quickly. As things have gotten more structured and organized, naturally, some of the freedoms of a more organic and adaptive organization have become more limited.
pros: -Incredible culture that celebrates diversity at every turn, fiercely protects its environmental impact, and values people above profit.-The skills Apple will teach you not only make you successful in your role and industry, but also translate to relationships and overall being a person who helps move the world forward in positive ways.-Leadership is very supportive and works very hard to ensure people feel s… upported and developed.

cons: Transfers to different positions do take time. They want to make sure they have the right fit, and sometimes there just aren't any available for a period of time.
pros: I loved my time with Apple. They train their employees really well and give them the tools to succeed in customer interactions. My managers always backed up what I told customers, and if they decided to make an exception, they made sure customers knew it was a special circumstance. They were also really supportive in helping me find the best career path for me. Benefits, compensation and time off were great for a ret… ail position.

cons: A lot of hours during weekends and holidays
advice: They do a great job in hiring and instilling the apple culture from day one
pros: You can't beat the discounts and benefits of working with such a prestigious company

cons: can get very busy at times

That pathway is not always clear but the company continues to develop talent even when it means losing a valued employee from the retail space.
pros: Progressive company. Egalitarian. Employees first philosophy which redounds to unmatched customer relations. Incredible hiring practices in the retail environment.

advice: Treat your employees well, bend over backwards and watch them do the same for you.
pros: Great company to work for, I've learned a lot. Apple is the type of company where you put a lot of hard work in it does pay off.
